squidpony.squidmath

Class NumberTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidmath.NumberTools

  • public class NumberTools
extends Object
    Various numeric functions that are important to performance but need alternate implementations on GWT to obtain it. Super-sourced on GWT, but most things here are direct calls to JDK methods when on desktop or Android.

      • randomFloat

      • randomSignedFloat

        public static float randomSignedFloat(int seed)
        Generates a pseudo-random float between -1.0f (exclusive) and 1.0f (exclusive) using the given int seed, passing it once through the (very high-quality and rather fast) PintRNG algorithm, derived from PCG-Random. This produces a random int, which this produces a float from using intBitsToFloat(int) (long)} or something functionally equivalent on GWT. The sign bit of the result is determined by data that is not used by the float otherwise, and keeps the results almost linear in distribution between -1.0 and 1.0, exclusive for both (0 shows up twice as often as any single other result, but this shouldn't affect the odds very strongly; it's about a 1 in 8 million chance of exactly 0 occurring vs. a 1 in 16 million of any other specific float this can produce).
        Consider calling this with NumberTools.randomSignedFloat(seed += 0x9E3779B9) for an optimal period of 2 to the 32 when repeatedly called, but NumberTools.randomSignedFloat(++seed) will also work just fine.
        Parameters:
        seed - any int to be used as a seed
        Returns:
        a pseudo-random float from -1.0f (exclusive) to 1.0f (exclusive)

      • randomDoubleCurved

        public static double randomDoubleCurved(int seed)
